verses.verse: Yet now<WH6258> hear,<WH8085> O Jacob<WH3290> my servant;<WH5650> and Israel,<WH3478> whom I have chosen: <WH977>

For <WH3588> I will pour<WH3332> water<WH4325> upon<WH5921> him that is thirsty,<WH6771> and floods<WH5140> upon<WH5921> the dry ground:<WH3004> I will pour<WH3332> my spirit<WH7307> upon<WH5921> thy seed,<WH2233> and my blessing<WH1293> upon<WH5921> thine offspring: <WH6631>
And they shall spring up<WH6779> as among<WH996> the grass,<WH2682> as willows<WH6155> by<WH5921> the water<WH4325> courses.<WH2988>

One <WH2088> shall say,<WH559> I<WH589> am the LORD's;<WH3068> and another<WH2088> shall call<WH7121> himself by the name<WH8034> of Jacob;<WH3290> and another<WH2088> shall subscribe<WH3789> with his hand<WH3027> unto the LORD,<WH3068> and surname<WH3655> himself by the name<WH8034> of Israel.<WH3478>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> the King<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> and his redeemer<WH1350> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts;<WH6635> I<WH589> am the first,<WH7223> and I<WH589> am the last;<WH314> and beside<WH4480> <WH1107> me there is no<WH369> God.<WH430>

And who,<WH4310> as I, shall call,<WH7121> and shall declare<WH5046> it, and set it in order<WH6186> for me, since I appointed<WH4480> <WH7760> the ancient<WH5769> people?<WH5971> and the things that are coming,<WH857> and shall come,<WH935> let them show<WH5046> unto them.

Fear <WH6342> ye not,<WH408> neither<WH408> be afraid:<WH7297> have not<WH3808> I told<WH8085> thee from that time,<WH4480> <WH227> and have declared<WH5046> it? ye<WH859> are even my witnesses.<WH5707> Is there<WH3426> a God<WH433> beside<WH4480> <WH1107> me? yea, there is no<WH369> God;<WH6697> I know<WH3045> not<WH1077> any.

They that make<WH3335> a graven image<WH6459> are all<WH3605> of them vanity;<WH8414> and their delectable things<WH2530> shall not<WH1077> profit;<WH3276> and they<WH1992> are their own witnesses;<WH5707> they see<WH7200> not,<WH1077> nor<WH1077> know;<WH3045> that<WH4616> they may be ashamed.<WH954>
Who <WH4310> hath formed<WH3335> a god,<WH410> or molten<WH5258> a graven image<WH6459> that is profitable<WH3276> for nothing?<WH1115>

Behold, <WH2005> all<WH3605> his fellows<WH2270> shall be ashamed:<WH954> and the workmen,<WH2796> they<WH1992> are of men:<WH4480> <WH120> let them all<WH3605> be gathered together,<WH6908> let them stand up;<WH5975> yet they shall fear,<WH6342> and they shall be ashamed<WH954> together.<WH3162>

The blacksmith<WH2796> <WH1270> with the tongs<WH4621> both worketh<WH6466> in the coals,<WH6352> and fashioneth<WH3335> it with hammers,<WH4717> and worketh<WH6466> it with the strength<WH3581> of his arms:<WH2220> yea,<WH1571> he is hungry,<WH7456> and his strength<WH3581> faileth:<WH369> he drinketh<WH8354> no<WH3808> water,<WH4325> and is faint.<WH3286>

The carpenter<WH2796> <WH6086> stretcheth out<WH5186> his rule;<WH6957> he marketh it out<WH8388> with a line;<WH8279> he fitteth<WH6213> it with planes,<WH4741> and he marketh it out<WH8388> with the compass,<WH4230> and maketh<WH6213> it after the figure<WH8403> of a man,<WH376> according to the beauty<WH8597> of a man;<WH120> that it may remain<WH3427> in the house.<WH1004>

He heweth him down<WH3772> cedars,<WH730> and taketh<WH3947> the cypress<WH8645> and the oak,<WH437> which he strengtheneth<WH553> for himself among the trees<WH6086> of the forest:<WH3293> he planteth<WH5193> an ash,<WH766> and the rain<WH1653> doth nourish<WH1431> it.

Then shall it be<WH1961> for a man<WH120> to burn:<WH1197> for he will take<WH3947> thereof,<WH4480> and warm<WH2552> himself; yea,<WH637> he kindleth<WH5400> it, and baketh<WH644> bread;<WH3899> yea,<WH637> he maketh<WH6466> a god,<WH410> and worshipeth<WH7812> it; he maketh<WH6213> it a graven image,<WH6459> and falleth down<WH5456> thereto.

He burneth<WH8313> part<WH2677> thereof in<WH1119> the fire;<WH784> with<WH5921> part<WH2677> thereof he eateth<WH398> flesh;<WH1320> he roasteth<WH6740> roast,<WH6748> and is satisfied:<WH7646> yea,<WH637> he warmeth<WH2552> himself, and saith,<WH559> Aha,<WH1889> I am warm,<WH2552> I have seen<WH7200> the fire: <WH217>

And the residue<WH7611> thereof he maketh<WH6213> a god,<WH410> even his graven image:<WH6459> he falleth down<WH5456> unto it, and worshipeth<WH7812> it, and prayeth<WH6419> unto<WH413> it, and saith,<WH559> Deliver<WH5337> me; for<WH3588> thou<WH859> art my god.<WH410>

They have not<WH3808> known<WH3045> nor<WH3808> understood:<WH995> for<WH3588> he hath shut<WH2902> their eyes,<WH5869> that they cannot see;<WH4480> <WH7200> and their hearts,<WH3820> that they cannot understand.<WH4480> <WH7919>

And none<WH3808> considereth<WH7725> in<WH413> his heart,<WH3820> neither<WH3808> is there knowledge<WH1847> nor<WH3808> understanding<WH8394> to say,<WH559> I have burned<WH8313> part<WH2677> of it in<WH1119> the fire;<WH784> yea,<WH637> also I have baked<WH644> bread<WH3899> upon<WH5921> the coals<WH1513> thereof; I have roasted<WH6740> flesh,<WH1320> and eaten<WH398> it: and shall I make<WH6213> the residue<WH3499> thereof an abomination?<WH8441> shall I fall down<WH5456> to the stock<WH944> of a tree?<WH6086>

He feedeth<WH7462> on ashes:<WH665> a deceived<WH2048> heart<WH3820> hath turned him aside,<WH5186> that he cannot<WH3808> deliver<WH5337> <WH853> his soul,<WH5315> nor<WH3808> say,<WH559> Is there not<WH3808> a lie<WH8267> in my right hand?<WH3225>

Remember <WH2142> these,<WH428> O Jacob<WH3290> and Israel;<WH3478> for<WH3588> thou<WH859> art my servant:<WH5650> I have formed<WH3335> thee; thou<WH859> art my servant:<WH5650> O Israel,<WH3478> thou shalt not<WH3808> be forgotten<WH5382> of me.
I have blotted out,<WH4229> as a thick cloud,<WH5645> thy transgressions,<WH6588> and, as a cloud,<WH6051> thy sins:<WH2403> return<WH7725> unto<WH413> me; for<WH3588> I have redeemed<WH1350> thee.

Sing, <WH7442> O ye heavens;<WH8064> for<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> hath done<WH6213> it: shout,<WH7321> ye lower parts<WH8482> of the earth:<WH776> break forth<WH6476> into singing,<WH7440> ye mountains,<WH2022> O forest,<WH3293> and every<WH3605> tree<WH6086> therein: for<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> hath redeemed<WH1350> Jacob,<WH3290> and glorified himself<WH6286> in Israel.<WH3478>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> thy redeemer,<WH1350> and he that formed<WH3335> thee from the womb,<WH4480> <WH990> I<WH595> am the LORD<WH3068> that maketh<WH6213> all<WH3605> things; that stretcheth forth<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> alone;<WH905> that spreadeth abroad<WH7554> the earth<WH776> by<WH854> myself;

That frustrateth<WH6565> the tokens<WH226> of the liars,<WH907> and maketh diviners mad;<WH1984> <WH7080> that turneth<WH7725> wise<WH2450> men backward,<WH268> and maketh their knowledge foolish;<WH5528> <WH1847>

That confirmeth<WH6965> the word<WH1697> of his servant,<WH5650> and performeth<WH7999> the counsel<WH6098> of his messengers;<WH4397> that saith<WH559> to Jerusalem,<WH3389> Thou shalt be inhabited;<WH3427> and to the cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> Ye shall be built,<WH1129> and I will raise up<WH6965> the decayed places<WH2723> thereof:
That saith<WH559> to the deep,<WH6683> Be dry,<WH2717> and I will dry up<WH3001> thy rivers: <WH5104>

That saith<WH559> of Cyrus,<WH3566> He is my shepherd,<WH7462> and shall perform<WH7999> all<WH3605> my pleasure:<WH2656> even saying<WH559> to Jerusalem,<WH3389> Thou shalt be built;<WH1129> and to the temple,<WH1964> Thy foundation shall be laid.<WH3245>
